content.question: Show all your work. Indicate clearly the methods you use, because you will be scored on the correctness of your methods as well as on the accuracy and completeness of your results and explanations. A biologist gathered data on the length, in millimeters (<math alttext="m m" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>mm</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>), and the mass, in grams <math alttext="g" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><mtext>g</mtext><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>, for <math alttext="11" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>11</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> bullfrogs. The data are shown in Plot <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>. (a) Based on the scatterplot, describe the relationship between mass and length, in context.

frqParts.text: Show all your work. Indicate clearly the methods you use, because you will be scored on the correctness of your methods as well as on the accuracy and completeness of your results and explanations. A biologist gathered data on the length, in millimeters (<math alttext="m m" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>mm</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>), and the mass, in grams <math alttext="g" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><mtext>g</mtext><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>, for <math alttext="11" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>11</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> bullfrogs. The data are shown in Plot <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>. (a) Based on the scatterplot, describe the relationship between mass and length, in context.

From the data, the biologist calculated the least-squares regression line for predicting mass from length. The least-squares regression line is shown in Plot <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>.(b) Identify and interpret the slope of the least-squares regression line in context.

(c) Interpret the coefficient of determination of the least-squares regression line, <math alttext="r squared is approximately equal to 0.819" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>r</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>â‰ˆ</mo><mn>0.819</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>, in context.

(d) From Plot <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>, consider the residuals of the <math alttext="11" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>11</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> bullfrogs.(i) Based on the plot, approximately what is the length and mass of the bullfrog with the largest absolute value residual?(ii) Does the least-squares regression line overestimate or underestimate the mass of the bullfrog identified in part (d-i)? Explain your answer.

topic.text: 2.4: Representing the Relationship Between Two Quantitative Variables

skill.text: Skill 2.A: Describe data presented numerically or graphically.
